title: Justin Bieber and Logan Paul: Star supports YouTuber in KSI rematch
text:
Justin is apparently planning on showing up to support Logan in his fight against KSI (Picture: Getty/Gotham/GC Images)

Yesterday YouTuber Logan Paul revealed that hit-maker Justin Bieber will be in the audience to watch his hugely-anticipated boxing fight again fellow internet star KSI.

The fight, which is taking place next month on November 9 2019 at the Staples Center in LA, has garnered worldwide attention after the rematch was announced thanks to the huge followings of both Logan Paul and KSI.

The first fight between the Youtube stars, which ended in a draw, was dubbed as the ‘Biggest Internet Event in History’ when it took place at Manchester Arena last year in front of 18,000 fans.

This year’s match promises to be even bigger and A-list names such as Justin Bieber wading in to comment on the fight only serves to generate more attention for the event in the build-up.

But how do Logan Paul and Justin Bieber know each other and why is Justin speaking up about the match?

Justin Bieber and Logan Paul’s friendship

Justin Bieber and Logan Paul were first linked when the Biebs referenced Logan’s YouTube videos with his brother Jake Paul.

In a video posted by YouTuber Christian Beadles titled The Boys are back in town! over a year ago, JB joined him as they went on a road trip to the snow.

In the video, Justin appears to mimic the way the Paul brothers introduce their videos by saying: ‘What’s up, vlog? It’s vlog city time, vlog time with your boys Christian and JB’ before mirroring the boys’ inspirational message to fans by saying: ‘It’s not what you do, it’s who you are.’

While at the time some fans thought Justin may have been shading Logan, it appears that the YouTuber actually took the reference from the Sorry hit-maker as a compliment and, since then, the two have struck up some sort of friendship.

Olajide William Olatunji aka KSI and Logan Paul have been trash talking each other for some time and now celebs like Justin Bieber are taking sides. (Picture: Michael Tran/Getty Images)

The pair have been supportive of one another and their work for some time now. Justin first weighed in on Logan and KSI’s ongoing feud by backing Logan in his Instagram comments in August earlier this year, before urging Logan to ‘rip KSI’s head off’ in September.

A little dramatic perhaps, but still, it’s clear Justin is gunning for Logan in the tense showdown to come.

Understandably, KSI was less than impressed with Bieber’s barbs, telling TMZ Sport earlier this month: ‘I hope Justin Bieber’s gonna be ringside, so after I knock out Logan, I can be like, ‘Whose head was gonna get ripped off?!? You p***k.’’

KSI does not count himself a Justin Bieber fan (Picture: Gotham/GC Images)

Well what do you know, it appears the Biebs will be ringside at the match, as Logan sent a shout-out this week to his friends, family and fans that will be attending the fight, confirming that Justin will be in attendance and will be sitting in prime position for the event – next to the YouTube star’s parents.

‘There’s going to be some big celebrities coming, I think Bieber is coming. I’m gonna place him next to my mother and father,’ Logan said.

Logan’s support for Justin goes beyond just inviting him to watch him fight though. Just this week, Logan Paul shared a post to his Stories on Instagram, showing support for Justin’s music ahead of his potential new album release before Christmas.

It doesn’t look like the pals were close enough for Logan to secure an invite to Justin’s star-studded wedding to Hailey Bieber earlier this month however, but perhaps the YouTuber would have been too busy training for the fight to attend anyway.
